message: It's finally happened. 10-year-old Facebook is now worth more than 104-year-old IBM.
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: I'm afraid facebook is a bubble, any decent investor would check the P/E ratio! Facebook is only for speculators, with no clear cashflow in the near future this bubble will eventually burst!
Facebook P/E ratio is 79 while IBM is solid 11! you can't even compare them!
Actually despite the numbers but I think that too... Facebook simply lacks vision
Their ads are a big scam! tried them before and they cost alot while feeling like getting random clicks!

Yes now I remembered this video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oVfHeWTKjag
Yeah, seen before, sadly Egypt is one of the biggest click farms! doesn't this ring a bell?
Stock price is not a good way to value the contributions of a technology company because the stock market doesn't know anything about technology.

IBM and Facebook have nothing in common in terms of services nor products, it is hard and even unrealistic to make a comparison between them, we might as well compare IBM to McDonalds while we're at it.
I don't think also FB Revenue comes any near to IBM if you even try to compare the Revenue of the 2 companies. IBM is the Elephant!

Strongly agreed with Amr Eldib, IBM is a computing behemoth, invented so many things that became now standard for daily life computing and communication. Its patents portfolio ONLY makes revenue more than top software companies like Oracle, NetApp & Others
